message_1: In a round-robin tournament of 10 teams, each team plays every other team exactly once. How many matches are there in total?
message_2:
In a round-robin tournament with 10 teams, we can use the formula for combinations to determine the total number of matches. The formula for combinations is:

C(n, k) = n! / (k!(n-k)!)

where n is the total number of teams and k is the size of the combination (in this case, 2 teams playing each other).

So, for a 10-team tournament:

C(10, 2) = 10! / (2!(10-2)!)
C(10, 2) = 10! / (2!8!)
C(10, 2) = (10 × 9 × 8!)/(2 × 8!)
C(10, 2) = (10 × 9) / 2
C(10, 2) = 90 / 2
C(10, 2) = 45

There are 45 matches in total in a round-robin tournament with 10 teams.
